name: BEST WESTERN Monopole Metropole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights. Fellow travllers say it all - excellent staff, convenient location, spacious room, clean bathroom, and probably the best buffet breakfast in terms of quality, quantity and variety through my week's travel in Alsace and Champagne. We were "only" in a standard room but I think it's more than adequate by European standard. The free Wifi worked too.
reviews.title: Nothing to fault

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived here early in the morning so the lovely lady at the front desk stored our luggage while we explored and had breakfast. We returned about an hour before we were told room would be ready and it was already available. The room was a nice size for France and the bathroom was quite large. The hotel does seem a bit dated but it really adds to the Alsacian homey charm. Breakfast was great, offering much variety of standard European breakfast: cereals, cheeses, breads, croissants/pastries/baguettes, scrambled and soft boiled eggs. There is a bar near the front desk that is always empty. Since there is nobody attending the bar you just ask the staff at front desk to prepare your drink. They were always happy to do so and served them with a snack mix. The pleasant walk to the square and surrounding areas is 10-15 minutes. The walk is lovely and would choose it over staying right in the hustle and bustle. We felt very welcomed by the staff and would recommend this hotel for its value.
reviews.title: great value, great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you have luggage, and you use the train to come and to leave, and you also take day trips from the station, just like what I did, I would highly recommend this hotel. It is just a 5 minute walk from station, and a comfortable walk to the the tourist sites. Strasbourg is a small city, and it took us about 5-10 minutes to the closet sites, and another 5-10 for those further south, with the farthest ones in less than half an hour in total. The room is nicely furnished for a 3-star level. I spent most of my day out, so I found the room adequately big for a take-away supper, and a good night's sleep. Good value for money with the 70 euros I paid for a day.
reviews.title: value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights from 15th August to have a short break in Strasbourg to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We arrived about 6pm and as it was a Public Holiday, with most restaurants closed, asked at reception for suggestions for an evening meal. We were asked how far we wished to walk and then given suggestions based on our answer. We had an excellent meal and also, on our return to the hotel, were given suggestions for sight seeing for the remainder of our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location – Perfect location and quiet. 5 minutes walk from the main station and 7-8 minutes walk to Petit France. We were not disturbed by noise at all during our stay.
reviews.title: Very good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room – initially I was quite shocked by how the room looked – bright colours and quite sparse BUT it was large, newly refurbished and had superb, quiet air-conditioning and every amenity you could want. The beds (two “Austrian” style singles in one double frame with separate duvets) suited us perfectly being used to these at home. The pillows and duvets were lovely. Bathroom, small but great, new waterfall shower. The room looked out onto a fire escape/courtyard so was not a pleasant view but it meant we had a very quiet night. In room safe, iron/ironing board, great hairdryer, complete window blinds for darkness, tea/coffee making facilities - Everything has been thought of.
reviews.title: Beautiful room and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff – all welcoming and very helpful. An excellent recommendation was given by the lady on reception for a restaurant for dinner and a special mention must go to the barman on duty on the Saturday evening we stayed. A wonderful, attentive and humorous gentleman, really finished off our evening to be served by him for our night cap.
reviews.title: Good choise!!

aka: Best Western Monopole Metropole Hotel Strasbourg
description: The Best Western Hotel Monopole Métropole, close to the TGV train station and the old town La Petite France, is one of the most historical of Strasbourg. Discover the charms of the lounges with antiques and paintings of famous Alsatian artists and visit the collections featured in the “little museum” at the lobby. The rooms, traditionally furbished or contemporary styled are all non smoking and air conditioned.
